publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4479 Stewart Stevenson: World No Tobacco Day 2006: "Tobacco Deadly in any form or disguise"—That the Parliament welcomes Wednesday 31 May 2006 as World No Tobacco Day which is the only established global event to draw attention to the impact of tobacco use on the public’s health and helps to reduce tobacco dependence, while encouraging countries and governments to work towards strict regulation of tobacco products; believes that Scotland has taken a major step forward by introducing a ban on smoking in public places which has given workers and others the benefit of a clean working environment, and hopes that the ban will encourage many smokers to kick the habit. Supported by: Fergus Ewing*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Eleanor Scott*, Rob Gibson*, Brian Adam*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Mark Ballard*, Shiona Baird*, Richard Lochhead*, Mr John Swinney*, Patrick Harvie*, Jackie Baillie*, Chris Ballance*, Bruce Crawford*
S2M-4479 World No Tobacco Day 2006: "Tobacco Deadly in any form or disguise" (lodged on 31 May 2006) Robin Harper*, Ms Maureen Watt*, Trish Godman*, Michael Matheson*
